title: They are reworking Gangplank, there is a major concern about Gangplank...
body: Will he still be able to eat oranges and be K?

replies.body:
At the start of the GP rework we sat down and did some hard thinking about what defined Gangplank. Our eventual conclusions were:

* Primary identity - Eats oranges and is k.
* Secondary identity - Pirate, plus some other stuff.

Ok, that's a bit of an exaggeration. Post rework GP's still going to be eating citrus fruit and then feeling fine though.

reliable global waveclear is a massive tool for wavecontroll that alone would be sufficient. But it also really provides a lot of magical dmg in teamfights and makes it a little easier to peel for your backline...and the cd isn´t even that high.

80% slow, though... you know how low you'd have to make the damage for something like that to get past? Hell, even the 60% is really, really pushing it since you don't have to aim like you would for an Ashe ult. You could be top lane and help so much with a bot lane gank without even leaving that it'd be absurd. The rest of his kit would suffer horribly for that ult. 

As much as I like the sounds of a buff for his ult, that would be flying way above "overdoing it" in a commercial jet while the phrase plods along in a car.

I think a huge part of GP's identity is making mad booty like the gold grubbing pirate that he is, as well as being a generalist. 

His Q is pretty iconic, as a result of that. Massive crit shots and making money, mostly.

So, major Supplank fan here. I heard they are basically gutting E for support. Is he getting anything else back as compensation? And will he retain his generally high natural speed from E?

And one last thing. Can I get him to not get bruiser Champion Mastery titles? It's not outright embarassing like AD Ahri or something, but that's not how I play him, and my titles should be reflecting that. Is my Champion Mastery progress reflecting that? I heard rumors that you are only compared to people who play similarly to you, not just in champion, but I have doubts. Afterall, there aren't a whole lot of Supplanks out there to compare me to...

We're giving him a new E, rather than gutting the power from the current one. I suspect the replacement won't be as useful for supportplank, apologies if that ends up removing a playstyle that it sounds like you really enjoy. Bit early to comment on details like how much attack speed/movement speed GP will have post rework. We've got the big picture generally figured out, but haven't gone through the balancing process yet, so specific numbers are subject to change.

Not sure on the champion mastery questions sorry, different team to the ones I work with, so I'm not familiar with the details of how it functions or possible future plans.

I have two questions:
1) Can we expect GP's rework to hit PBE after patch 5.11 or is it too early?
2) GP's passive movement speed is a very important part of his kit right now since it allows to skip the purchase of boots (or at least to sell them lightheartedly later on in the game). So, even though E looks like an underwhelming skill, it kinda grants a whole sixth item of stats when GP is full build. Has this been considered while balancing the new GP? 

A last curiosity of mine is: while reworking him, do you aim at making him a viable pick (perhaps even in competitive play) or your primary concern is to keep his piratesque identity while giving his kit a more modern façade?
